security: The article discusses potential links between Cuban exiles, the Venezuelan secret police (DISIP), the CIA, and the Chilean secret police in relation to the Letelier assassination, which could expose sensitive international relationships and ongoing investigations. Quoting directly: "Our friends in Washington used to be simple journalists and policy analysts. Now they are three-pay-phone men. That means you can't call them without using three pay phones." and "The last time I called they told me we would be walking into four nests of known killers: the Cuban exiles in Venezuela, the Venezuelan secret police, the C.I.A. and the Chilean secret police."
summary: This document contains excerpts from an article discussing investigations into the assassination of Orlando Letelier, exploring potential connections to Cuban exiles, Venezuelan secret police, the CIA, and Chilean secret police. It details the experiences of reporters traveling to Caracas to investigate these connections.
summary_one_paragraph: The document includes excerpts from an Esquire article in March 1977, recounting reporters Taylor Branch and John Rothchild's investigation into the Orlando Letelier assassination and their experiences in Caracas. The article discusses potential links between various groups, including Cuban exiles, the Venezuelan secret police (DISIP), the CIA, and the Chilean secret police. The reporters encounter suspicious Miami law enforcement officials and are summoned by DISIP upon arrival in Caracas, leading to a series of uneasy interactions and raising questions about the motives and involvements of the various parties.
title: Article Excerpt: "The Incident" by Taylor Branch and John Rothchild
